story.name: e9fa3db8-6b5b-431b-a64c-95969c76ab0e
story.title: EU moves towards sanctions on Nicaragua
story.summary: The EU on Wednesday approved a framework to impose sanctions against individuals in Nicaragua, where the UN has warned of serious rights abuses during a crackdown on opposition protests.Ambassadors from the 28 EU countries signed off on the legal framework needed to apply targeted measures against those identified as responsible for violations, diplomatic sources told AFP.The Central American state, led since 2006 by President Daniel Ortega, has been gripped by crisis since April 2018, when...

xmlText.p: The EU on Wednesday approved a framework to impose sanctions against individuals in Nicaragua, where the UN has warned of serious rights abuses during a crackdown on opposition protests.
Ambassadors from the 28 EU countries signed off on the legal framework needed to apply targeted measures against those identified as responsible for violations, diplomatic sources told AFP.

The Central American state, led since 2006 by President Daniel Ortega, has been gripped by crisis since April 2018, when opposition protests mushroomed into a popular uprising that was met with a brutal crackdown.
Political violence left more than 300 people dead and 2,000 wounded, according to rights groups, while hundreds of opposition supporters were jailed and tens of thousands of people fled the country.

In a report this month, UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet detailed a wide range of violations, including extrajudicial killings, violence by pro-government armed groups, arbitrary detention, sexual violence and torture.
